topic_name: AWS Services (S3, EBS, EFS, Glacier, AWS Storage Gateway)..

questions.question: A web application needs to store user-uploaded images that will be accessed frequently for the first month, then rarely accessed but must remain available. Which AWS storage strategy would be most cost-effective?
options: Store all images in S3 Standard permanently
Store images in EBS volumes with snapshots
Use S3 with lifecycle policies to transition to S3 Glacier after 30 days
Use EFS for shared access across multiple instances
questions.explanation: S3 with lifecycle policies allows automatic transition from frequently accessed storage (S3 Standard) to long-term archival storage (Glacier) based on age, optimizing costs while maintaining availability.

questions.question: A financial services company needs to run a database that requires consistent, high-performance storage with low latency. The database runs on a single EC2 instance. Which storage service is most appropriate?
options: Amazon S3 for its durability
Amazon EFS for shared access
Amazon EBS with Provisioned IOPS
Amazon Glacier for cost savings
questions.explanation: EBS with Provisioned IOPS provides high-performance, low-latency block storage that can be attached to a single EC2 instance, making it ideal for database workloads requiring consistent performance.

questions.question: Your company has an on-premises file server that needs to gradually migrate to the cloud while maintaining local access to frequently used files. Which service would best facilitate this hybrid approach?
options: Replace the file server entirely with S3
Use EFS mounted directly to on-premises servers
Implement AWS Storage Gateway in File Gateway mode
Set up EBS volumes accessible from on-premises
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway in File Gateway mode creates a hybrid solution that presents cloud storage as a local file share, caching frequently accessed data locally while storing everything in S3.

questions.question: A machine learning team needs shared storage that multiple EC2 instances across different Availability Zones can access simultaneously for training data. What's the best solution?
options: EBS Multi-Attach volumes
S3 buckets with direct access
Amazon EFS with multiple mount targets
Multiple EBS volumes with data replication
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS provides fully managed NFS that can be mounted simultaneously by multiple EC2 instances across different AZs, making it ideal for shared access to training data.

questions.question: A media company needs to archive 10 years of video content that may need to be retrieved once or twice per year for legal compliance. Retrieval time of several hours is acceptable. Which storage option provides the best value?
options: S3 Standard for immediate access
S3 Glacier Instant Retrieval for quick access
S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval for balanced cost and access
S3 Glacier Deep Archive for maximum cost savings
questions.explanation: S3 Glacier Deep Archive offers the lowest cost for long-term archival with very infrequent access. The 12-hour retrieval time is acceptable for the use case, making it the most cost-effective option.
